hipi.image
Class FloatImage

java.lang.Object
  hipi.image.FloatImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Comparator<org.apache.hadoop.io.BinaryComparable>, org.apache.hadoop.io.RawComparator<org.apache.hadoop.io.BinaryComparable>, org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable
public class FloatImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable, org.apache.hadoop.io.RawComparator<org.apache.hadoop.io.BinaryComparable>

Base class for FloatImage's. A FloatImage is just an array of floating-point values along with information about the dimensions of the image that array represents. The is the default image type that is used in HIPI. You can convert to other image types using ImageConverter.

See Also:
ImageConverter

Returns:
a FloatImage containing the cropped portion of the original image

convert

public FloatImage convert(int type)
Convert between color types (black and white, grayscale, etc.). Currently only RGB2GRAY

Returns:
A FloatImage of the converted image. Returns null if the image could not be converted

compare

public int compare(byte[] byte_array1,
                   int start1,
                   int length1,
                   byte[] byte_array2,
                   int start2,
                   int length2)
This method comes from the RawComparator class and allows sorting to happen much faster than in the normal Comparable interface. For a discussion of this, see Hadoop: The Definitive Guide. Essentially, this method avoids deserializing the entire FloatImage object before doing a comparison. Since the first bytes indicate the size of the image, we can just read a small segment of the byte array to get the sizes. TODO: Ensure that the second and fifth parameters are actually defining the start

Specified by:
compare in interface org.apache.hadoop.io.RawComparator<org.apache.hadoop.io.BinaryComparable>
